name: MIT OpenCourseWare: Single Variable Calculus (18.01SC)
description: A complete course covering differentiation and integration of functions of one variable. It includes lecture videos, notes, problem sets, exams and interactive applets. Ideal for self‑study and review.

name: MIT OpenCourseWare: Linear Algebra (18.06)
description: An introductory course on matrix theory and linear algebra. Topics include systems of equations, vector spaces, determinants, eigenvalues, similarity and positive‑definite matrices.

name: Paul’s Online Math Notes (Lamar University)
description: A comprehensive site offering free notes for Calculus I–III and Differential Equations. Each chapter includes worked examples, explanations and practice problems.

name: Feynman Lectures on Physics – Volume I (Mechanics), Volume II (Electromagnetism), Volume III (Quantum Mechanics)
description: Caltech hosts a high‑quality online edition of Feynman, Leighton & Sands’s classic lectures. The volumes are free to read online and cover mechanics, radiation, heat, electromagnetism, matter and quantum mechanics.

name: MIT OpenCourseWare: Quantum Physics I (8.04)
description: This undergraduate course introduces the experimental basis of quantum mechanics, wave mechanics and Schrödinger’s equation in one and three dimensions. The course provides lecture notes, video lectures, assignments and exams.
